src: nem a o-sob-de pere-ma o-ka ma e
trs: Well, here is what my father recounted to me.’\\

src: nem a a-na o-ya o-sob-ya o-sob-e-sob \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na-ee-na-e{\footnotemark}
trs: He said this, about my father’s father: “I heard that my father said: “I did this, they say.””’{\footnotemark}\\

src: ee-bo{\footnotemark} o-ya o-kãyna o-sade-ee-ka{\footnotemark} sona o-sob-wepika sona a o-sob-ya o-sob-de
trs: ““So as I grew up, I avenged my father many times.””’\\

src: ee-bo \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na sona \~{G}oxor-aka a-kah sona-e.
trs: So he repeatedly set out to kill some Zoró.’\\

src: a-yab-koy xi-ibeb-iga i-kar i-pere-de-na ihbahb-ma\~{g}a i-pere-de-na ee-yab-kar i-pere-de-kah-ee-na
trs: He repeatedly searched for them and followed their tracks, he repeatedly made a canoe and set out in search of some of them.’{\footnotemark}\\

src: a-yab-pi a-or te{\footnotemark} a-yab-pi a-akah ihbahb-tar ee-na te ma-kao-pi i-kar
trs: Afterward he came back, and after that, during the next dry season, he would set out again on a canoe in search of some of them.’\\

src: ee-na-itxa te i-pere-de-na sona \~{G}oxor-kar ee-na sona-e mater e a-sob-aka \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-ka-e o-ma-amõ-pere-de-na-ee-na-e
trs: Thus, my grandfather was always in search of some Zoró, long ago, because one of them had killed his father.’\\

src: ee-na o-sob-de-ee-na iwe-ma
trs: This is what my father said.’\\

src: ee-bo o-ya xi-ikin a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: He said: “[My father] said: “And once I saw him.””’ \\

src: ee-bo o-ya o-sob-karmey-itxa a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““I was with my father’s younger brother.””’\\

src: ee-bo o-oilud ee-na tar ã
trs: ““I was already a young man.””’{\footnotemark}\\

src: ee-te o-ya \~{G}oxor-ibeb-e-pe-maã tar a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de mixa\~{g}-mataga
trs: ““That time I had followed the track of a Zoró through the night.””’\\

src: o-ker õm a
trs: ““I had not slept at all.””’\\

src: mokãy-xibo-tor-wera o-ya xi-ibeb-maã tar a xi-pe-maã tar a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““I had followed his track carrying a torch, I had followed his path.””’\\

src: ee-bo o-ya-kah pe-tota o-sahr-a bobobob
trs: ““And I trotted away swiftly along the path.””’\\

src: bohb o-ya o-sahrokabi a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““Quickly, I approached, ducking under cover.””’\\

src: ã-ter o-ya xi-sab-abe-tâh-ikin a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““Here, I could see their house.””’{\footnotemark}\\

src: ye-ter oytxepo
trs: ““That’s perfect!””’\\

src: bohb o-ya o-sahrokabi a i-ka-ter a-kah a-na i
trs: ““Quickly, I approached nearer, ducking under cover, and I thought: “So is he staying in this one?”””’{\footnotemark}\\

src: ee-tiga te ta-ma-awuru-ya waohwaohwaoh awuru-ya ta-maniga-e-sor-ta o-ka tar a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““But then: \textit{Woof! Woof! Woof!} Their dog barked and did not let me come nearer to them.””’\\

src: a-tãr o-ka tar a
trs: ““It was already barking fiercely at me.””’\\

src: ee-tiga te o-ya nem awuru-pami tar a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““And me, well, I was scared of the dog.””’\\

src: eh méhk pa-sa-a-na pa-agah i o-ya tar a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: “““Oh, I realized, daybreak is coming, isn’t it?”””’\\

src: iye pa-mayahr-sid e-waba te e-sa-aye pa-iter-ey-kãra e-de-ee-ka aye ewe-pi\~{g}a pa-iter-ey-itxa ter o-sob-ya o-ka a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: “““All right, my father answered, you can say: “Let's go away.” I am worried about our people: because of what you did, there will be retaliations against us.”””’\\

src: ee-te awuru-sa-ee-na a-ker õm a waohwaohwaoh awuru-sa-ee-na a-tãr a
trs: ““And in the distance, the dog had not fallen asleep: \textit{Woof! Woof!} It was still barking fiercely.””’\\

src: o-e-na ter te bo-o-sa-kah a-sab-tiga{\footnotemark} yed-iway-ka ma-reh o-ya i-ka a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: “““Let me go and show the master of this house who I am!” I said to him.””’{\footnotemark}\\

src: bohb o-sahr-or
trs: ““I approached it quickly.””’\\

src: awuru-sade a-tãr ee-amaĩ{\footnotemark} te o-sahrokabi
trs: ““Although the dog was still fierce, I approached under cover.””’\\

imt: \textsc{endo-sim} \textsc{adv} \textsc{3sg}-master a.little \textsc{1sg}-stoop-swift-\textsc{vblz} \textsc{endo-sim} \textsc{endo} door-\textsc{dat} \textsc{dem.prox-foc} opening \textsc{q} \textsc{3.refl}-be.noisy dog \textsc{q-prs} \textsc{advers-1sg-prog} dog-\textsc{dat} \textsc{sfm.nwit} \textsc{3sg-nwit}{\footnotemark} \textsc{dem.prox-foc} opening-\textsc{vblz} \textsc{sfm.nwit} \textsc{3sg-nwit} \textsc{3sg-wit}
src: ee-tiga te xi-iway añum o-kabe-sahr-a ee-tiga ee mĩhna-ka a-na mehkap nan a-ariwa awuru ma-e\~{g}a bo-o-sa awuru-ka a \(\varnothing\)-ya a-na mehkap-a a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““As I was running up stooping, its master half-opened the door and thought about the dog: “What is making the dog bark?”””’\\

src: ah sehr awuru o-sahr-ikin a-de-ee-ka dik a-mĩhna-poga
trs: “““Ah, I see, dog!” he said as he saw me running up, and: \textit{Slam!} He shut the door.””’\\

src: turuk awuru-sa-kah-e-koy i-ya i-õm-a-niga a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““\textit{Whoosh!} The dog dodged its way in and disappeared inside.””’\\

src: ahwob sog sog{\footnotemark} o-ma-de-or xi-sab-ma-apa i
trs: ““But I had come already and: \textit{Puff!} I blew on my torch and: \textit{Whoosh! Whoosh!} I set fire to his house on both sides!””’\\

src: ee-tiga te etrrrk a-ma-ur-maã o-ka a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““It immediately caught fire and, inside, they picked up their bows to shoot at me.””’\\

src: ma-ya maã xi-ti-ya ma-pug-pi-ee-koy{\footnotemark} manáh tar a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““Another had seized his bow already, and because she heard him crying, the child's mother was insulting me.””’{\footnotemark}\\

src: o-ya ee-tiga te o-tepotê ted-te \~{G}oxor-ka tar a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““But I just kept on shooting arrows at the Zoró.””’\\

src: ee-bo o-ya-ee-na \~{G}oxor-sab-ma-apa a i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: ““Thus I burnt down the Zoró's house.””’\\

src: ee-bo o-ma-amõ-pere-de-na ee-na \~{G}oxor-ka xameomi ter \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na-ee-na-e a-sob-aka \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-ka-ee-na-ee-na-e
trs: My grandfather did this several times to the Zoró, he did it many times, because his father had been killed by one of them.’\\

src: oilud ee-na a-saba \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na ee-na ma-iter{\footnotemark} i-ka e
trs: He was young then, so he did it once again to them.’\\

src: a-yab-pi \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na ma-iter i-ka e
trs: And afterward, he did it once more to them.’\\

src: a-yab-pi \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na ma-iter xi-sab-ma-apa xi-sab-ma-apa ted-te i-pere-de-na sona-e.
trs: And afterward, he burnt one their houses down again, several times he just burnt a house down.’\\

src: o-ma-amõ-pere-de-na-e
trs: My grandfather did that again and again.’\\

src: ee-bo o-ya-ee-na \~{G}oxor-e-aka xi-sab-ma-apa o-sob-aka \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-ka ã o-sob-ya o-sob-de
trs: My father said this: “My father said this: “Thus I killed the Zoró, I burnt his house down, because he had killed my father.””’\\

src: ee-na
trs: It happened like this.’\\

src: a-yab-de-ee-na iwe-ewá{\footnotemark} i-ka e
trs: And he sang to celebrate this event.’\\

src: awuru-tih{\footnotemark}-ma ma-meko-ka o-ka o-pami-be-wẽtiga wẽtiga wẽtiga a{\footnotemark}
trs: “““The big dog sounded its fear of a jaguar, of me it sounded it, sounded it, they say.’\\

src: awuru-tih-ma ma-meko-ka o-ka
trs: The big dog, of a jaguar, of me,’\\

src: o-ya iwe-ewá a i-ya xi-ma-awuru-ma-aĩ o-de-ee-ewá a i-ya ee-na
trs: I sang this, I sang that I made his big dog run in, like this.””’\\

src: a-yab-pi ma-iter te
trs: Afterward, he did it once again.’\\

src: a-yab-pi \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na-ee-na te ee-na i-kãy-na a-saba ee-na xi-sab-ma-apa a-kah \~{G}oxor ee-na-e
trs: Afterward, he did it, when he grew up, he went and burnt down the Zoró’s house.’\\

src: ee-na a-sob-aka ee-ka te i-pere-de-na a-agõa-arih{\footnotemark} i-ka e
trs: Thus, because his father had been murdered, he remained merciless toward them.’\\

src: ee-bo \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na i-kãy-na a-saba ee-na-ee-na-e xi-sab-ma-apa a-kah e
trs: And he did it again when he grew up, he went and burnt down one of their houses.’\\

src: ee-bo \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na ee-pi xi-aka ee-na-e
trs: And afterward he killed another one.’\\

src: xi-sab-ma-apa a-kah ñorĩ ee-te xi-sab-ma-apa o-kabi ma sade-ee-na ma-ey-ka ee-te ee-petima\~{g}a a-saba
trs: He went away to burn down a Zoró house, he said to a few others: “Burn down their house for me!” and he lay in ambush.’\\

src: ee-bo ka-koy ee-na ma-pãri ma palo-de-ee-na sona i xi-sab-ma-apa sade-ee-ka-e ee-te i-sade-ee-na a-sab-alabiĩ so-ey-de-kah-ee-na pãri a-ma-ur-maã i-sa-ee-na ma-de-ani-e
trs: And while the house was burning up, he was watching and wondering: “Where is one making noise, is there someone?” because as one’s house is in flames, one moves things about and makes noise in search of one’s bow.’\\

src: ã-tiga-reh tap sok ee-na xi-aka ee-na-e
trs: “Let’s shoot now!” he thought, he fired his arrow and hit his target, that’s how he killed each one.’\\

src: a-yab-pi \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na ã-tiga ma-ano-petima\~{g}a ã-tiga ma-ano-petima\~{g}a ã-tiga ma-ano-petima\~{g}a ã-tiga ma-ano-petima\~{g}a
trs: And next to him, there was another one standing in ambush, and there another one, and there another one, and there another one.’{\footnotemark}\\

imt: \textsc{endo-adv} \textsc{dem.prox-sim} other-standing.up-\textsc{wit} shoot.arrow fire-inside \textsc{dem.prox-sim} other-standing.up noise \textsc{3sg-wit-endo-foc} \textsc{3.refl-poss}-bow-take \textsc{3sg-prog.sim} other-\textsc{prog-endo-foc} \textsc{dem.prox-sim-hort.pl} \textsc{id}:hit.target \textsc{endo-foc-3sg-dat-sfm.wit}
src: ee-te ã-tiga ma-ano-de mapa mokãy-ĩ ã-tiga ma-ano pãri \(\varnothing\)-de-ee-na a-ma-ur-maã i-sade ma-sa-ee-na ã-tiga-reh tap ee-na-i-ka-e
trs: Then one of them shot an arrow in the fire, and, as someone made noise in search of his bow, another one standing there thought: “Let’s shoot now,” and did it to that one.’\\

src: ee-te o-ya-ee-na ee-na ã i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de
trs: [My father] said: “He said: “So I did it that way.””’\\

src: ee-bo sab-de-ee-na a-apa ã i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de ewewaya \~{G}oxor-sade a-na a-pabiar a-werkar ano-koy ewe-nam-ka ee-na-i-ka ã i-yã \(\varnothing\)-de ano a-agaa-ap a-alap tap
trs: ““The house was burning up, the Zoró crawled on all fours and stretched out like this, and we shot at them.””{\footnotemark}\\

src: nem a-waĩ i-ka ã i-ya \(\varnothing\)-de eeerh
trs: ““One of us shot one of them, and he was dying.””’\\

src: ee-na o-ma-amõ-de-ee-na lahd-ka ee-na mater e
trs: That’s the way my grandfather treated the enemy long ago.’\\

src: bo te
trs: That’s it.’\\
